ygData.subject: Re: Release schedule
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, you have a thorough test plan at IA. I could only add a couple of general ideas. You mention that you judge a new software version by two things: * crawler

Hi,
you have a thorough test plan at IA. I could only add a couple of
general ideas. You mention that you judge a new software version by
two things:

* crawler behaviour 
* reports and log files produced by the crawl

But it could be worthwhile to look at the stuff that has been
downloaded. How well the crawler has downloaded difficult file types,
like streaming media or files that were generated from complex script
urls => Are the downloaded files complete and usable. I remember some
national libraries (Australia?) have written papers about how
different harvester software manage to download unusual file types.
Your url list 'many_seeds.txt' contains quite strange looking sites 
that should produce lots of problematic file types. 

(But maybe it's quite difficult at the moment to grab any individual
files out of heritrix archive files for testing purposes)

Do you have estimates on the number of files that your test servers
contain = can you say for sure that you can get about 100% from any
arbitrary server's contents, or 95%, or 80% or some other coverage. 



--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> The Archive Web Group had a meeting here this morning and hashed out
the 
> following rough release plan.  We thought the list would be
interested 
> to hear what was decided.
> 
> We'll probably make a 1.0.6 with a fix for "[ 1028913 ]
End-of-crawl 
> reports no happen (Stuck StatLogger): 
>
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=det
ail&aid=1028913&group_id=73833&atid=539099"

> this week or early next week (We're still trying to figure why no 
> reports at the end-of-crawl).
> 
> We're planning to code-freeze a 1.2 release around October 1st. 
We'll 
> then run it through our test cycle which comprises generally of a
week 
> of test crawls followed by a week of production crawls (A rough
Test 
> Plan can be found here: 
> http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?CrawlTestPlan).  1.2
will 
> have the priority 8 and above features from the RFE list which can
be 
> found here: 
> https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539102.  It
will 
> also have bugs that are priority 8 and above fixed from the bugs
list 
> which can be found here: 
> https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539099.
> 
> Comments?
> 
> Thanks,
> St.Ack
